meanings.definition: A plural form of the word 'sensum', meaning a perception or feeling.
meanings.sent1: Her sensa of joy was evident in her bright smile.
meanings.sent2: The sensa of fear overwhelmed him as he heard a loud noise.
meanings.sent3: The sensa of excitement bubbled up inside her like fizzy soda.
meanings.sent4: His sensa of loneliness was a heavy weight on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The sensa of warmth from the sun enveloped her like a cozy blanket.

meanings.definition: A plural form of the word 'sensum', meaning the faculty of perception.
meanings.sent1: The sensa of sight allows us to see the beauty of nature.
meanings.sent2: His sensa of smell helped him identify the delicious aroma of freshly baked bread.
meanings.sent3: The sensa of taste made her appreciate the flavors of the exotic dish.
meanings.sent4: Their sensa of touch guided them through the dark room with caution.
meanings.sent5: The sensa of hearing captured every note of the melodious music.

meanings.definition: A plural form of the word 'sensum', meaning awareness or consciousness.
meanings.sent1: His sensa of reality shifted as he entered the dream world.
meanings.sent2: The sensa of time passing slowly made the wait unbearable.
meanings.sent3: Their sensa of humor brightened up the dull meeting.
meanings.sent4: The sensa of danger tingled at the back of her mind.
meanings.sent5: The sensa of peace washed over him like a gentle wave.
